solution_line_template: First we must determine the percentage of the grey and green stones. We add the two amounts together, finding {grey_stones}+{green_stones}=<<{grey_stones}+{green_stones}={total_grey_green_stones}>>{total_grey_green_stones}

We then figure out that {grey_stones}/{total_grey_green_stones}=<<{grey_stones}/{total_grey_green_stones}={grey_percentage_decimal}>>{grey_percentage_decimal}, meaning 40 percent of the stones are grey in the second selection.

This means that {total_percentage_decimal}-{grey_percentage_decimal}= <<{total_percentage_decimal}-{grey_percentage_decimal}={green_percentage_decimal}>>{green_percentage_decimal}, or 60 percent of the stones are green.
Therefore, to find the number of white stones we multiply {total_first_collection_stones}*{green_percentage_decimal}= {white_stones} white stones.
